pushpin_mapsize = | pushpin_label_position = | footnotes = }} Pabellón de Arteaga is a city and the main seat of the municipality of the same name. It has a population of 47,646 (2020 INEGI Census) which makes it the third-most populous city in the state, just below Aguascalientes and Jesús María. It was founded in 1929 as an establishment for construction machinery for the Plutarco Elías Calles Dam, being founded as Colonia Progreso. == Climate == == References == * Link to tables of population data from Census of 2005 Instituto Nacional de Estadística, Geografía e Informática (INEGI) * Aguascalientes Enciclopedia de los Municipios de México * Ayuntamiento de Pabellón de Arteaga Official website (url status: dead) Category:Settlements in Aguascalientes Category:1929 establishments in North America Category:Towns in Mexico Category:Municipality seats in Aguascalientes
title: Pabellón de Arteaga
